com.jjoe64.graphview

Class GridLabelRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jjoe64.graphview.GridLabelRenderer

  • public class GridLabelRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
    The default renderer for the grid and the labels.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  GridLabelRenderer.GridStyle
      Definition which lines will be drawn in the background
      class  GridLabelRenderer.Styles
      wrapper for the styles regarding to the grid and the labels
      static class  GridLabelRenderer.VerticalLabelsVAlign
      Hoziontal label alignment

      the label formatter, that converts the raw numbers to strings

      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Double> mStepsHorizontal
      cache of the horizontal steps (vertical lines and horizontal labels) Value = x-value
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Double> mStepsVertical
      cache of the vertical steps (horizontal lines and vertical labels) Key = Pixel (y) Value = y-value
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Double> mStepsVerticalSecondScale
      cache of the vertical steps for the second scale, which is on the right side (horizontal lines and vertical labels) Key = Pixel (y) Value = y-value
      protected GridLabelRenderer.Styles mStyles
      wraps the styles regarding the grid and labels
      private java.lang.String mVerticalAxisTitle

      • mHumanRounding

        private boolean mHumanRounding
        activate or deactivate human rounding of the horizontal axis. GraphView tries to fit the labels to display numbers that can be divided by 1, 2, or 5. By default this is enabled. It makes sense to deactivate it when using Dates on the x axis.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GridLabelRenderer

        public GridLabelRenderer(GraphView graphView)
        create the default grid label renderer.
        Parameters:
        graphView - the corresponding graphview object

    • Method Detail

      • setSecondScaleLabelVerticalWidth

        public void setSecondScaleLabelVerticalWidth(java.lang.Integer newWidth)
        sets the space for the vertical labels on the right side
        Parameters:
        newWidth - set fixed width. set null to calculate it automatically

      • resetStyles

        public void resetStyles()
        resets the styles. This loads the style from reading the values of the current theme.

      • reloadStyles

        public void reloadStyles()
        will load the styles to the internal paint objects (color, text size, text align)

      • isHumanRounding

        public boolean isHumanRounding()
        GraphView tries to fit the labels to display numbers that can be divided by 1, 2, or 5. By default this is enabled. It makes sense to deactivate it when using Dates on the x axis.
        Returns:
        if human rounding is enabled

      • setHumanRounding

        public void setHumanRounding(boolean humanRounding)
        activate or deactivate human rounding of the horizontal axis. GraphView tries to fit the labels to display numbers that can be divided by 1, 2, or 5. By default this is enabled. It makes sense to deactivate it when using Dates on the x axis.
        Parameters:
        humanRounding - false to deactivate

      • getTextSize

        public float getTextSize()
        Returns:
        the general text size for the axis titles

        Returns:
        the font color of the vertical labels

        public int getHorizontalLabelsColor()
        Returns:
        the font color of the horizontal labels

      • getHorizontalLabelsAngle

        public float getHorizontalLabelsAngle()
        Returns:
        the angle of the horizontal labels

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate(boolean keepLabelsSize,
                       boolean keepViewport)
        clears the internal cache and forces to redraw the grid and labels. Normally you should always call GraphView.onDataChanged(boolean, boolean) which will call this method.
        Parameters:
        keepLabelsSize - true if you don't want to recalculate the size of the labels. It is recommended to use "true" because this will improve performance and prevent a flickering.
        keepViewport - true if you don't want that the viewport will be recalculated. It is recommended to use "true" for performance.

      • adjustVerticalSecondScale

        protected boolean adjustVerticalSecondScale()
        calculates the vertical steps of the second scale. This will not do any automatically update of the bounds. Use always manual bounds for the second scale.
        Returns:
        true if it is ready

      • adjustVertical

        protected boolean adjustVertical(boolean changeBounds)
        calculates the vertical steps. This will automatically change the bounds to nice human-readable min/max.
        Returns:
        true if it is ready

      • adjustHorizontal

        protected boolean adjustHorizontal(boolean changeBounds)
        calculates the horizontal steps.
        Parameters:
        changeBounds - This will automatically change the bounds to nice human-readable min/max.
        Returns:
        true if it is ready

      • adjustSteps

        protected void adjustSteps()
        adjusts the grid and labels to match to the data this will automatically change the bounds to nice human-readable values, except the bounds are manual.

      • humanRound

        protected double humanRound(double in,
                            boolean roundAlwaysUp)
        this will do rounding to generate nice human-readable bounds.
        Parameters:
        in - the raw value that is to be rounded
        roundAlwaysUp - true if it shall always round up (ceil)
        Returns:
        the rounded number

      • getStyles

        public GridLabelRenderer.Styles getStyles()
        Returns:
        the wrapped styles

      • getLabelVerticalWidth

        public int getLabelVerticalWidth()
        Returns:
        the vertical label width 0 if there are no vertical labels

      • setLabelVerticalWidth

        public void setLabelVerticalWidth(java.lang.Integer width)
        sets a manual and fixed with of the space for the vertical labels. This will prevent GraphView to calculate the width automatically.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the space for the vertical labels. Use null to let GraphView automatically calculate the width.

      • getLabelHorizontalHeight

        public int getLabelHorizontalHeight()
        Returns:
        the horizontal label height 0 if there are no horizontal labels

      • setLabelHorizontalHeight

        public void setLabelHorizontalHeight(java.lang.Integer height)
        sets a manual and fixed height of the space for the horizontal labels. This will prevent GraphView to calculate the height automatically.
        Parameters:
        height - the height of the space for the horizontal labels. Use null to let GraphView automatically calculate the height.
